meanings.definition: Important or influential people or things.
meanings.sent1: The biggies in the company always make important decisions.
meanings.sent2: She invited all the biggies in the industry to the event.
meanings.sent3: The biggies at the party were the ones with the fancy hats.
meanings.sent4: In the world of fashion, designers are the real biggies.
meanings.sent5: The biggies in the story were the heroes who saved the day.

meanings.definition: Large or significant events or occurrences.
meanings.sent1: The biggies of the year were the royal wedding and the big concert.
meanings.sent2: We can't miss the biggies like New Year's Eve celebrations.
meanings.sent3: The biggies of the party were the unexpected dance-off and the cake disaster.
meanings.sent4: The biggies of history include the moon landing and the fall of the Berlin Wall.
meanings.sent5: The biggies in the news today are the election results and the stock market crash.
